person.persName: Joshua Fry Bullitt (Louisville. Ct. of Appeals Judge)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and Judge of the Third District Court of Appeals. Jefferson County, Kentucky, native. Married Elizabeth B. Smith in 1846. Father of Joshsua Fry Bullitt, Jr. Attended Centre College in Danville, Kentucky. Studied law at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, Virginia. Admitted to the bar in Kentucky in 1844. Elected to the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Louisville in 1851 and 1853. Practiced law in partnership with S. B. Smith in 1859. Owned five enslaved people in Jefferson County in 1860. Elected Judge of the Third District of the Kentucky Court of Appeals in 1861. Served as Chief Justice of the Kentucky Court of Appeals from 1864 to June 3, 1865. Arrested in July 1864 for his sympathy to the Confederacy. Exiled to Memphis, Tennessee until November 22, 1864. Returned to Louisville on December 6, 1864. Fled to Canada to avoid arrest on December 27, 1864.
